column4: try running 'jockey-gtk' from the command line to see what the errors actually are?  (not sure I have a good grasp on the problem)
i'll do it in a while
ahah it's wonderful!! I hope it will be the same for me

after updating/upgrading the system, jockey-gtk is working and (i hope) properly installing the nvidia drivers. Still I get one error on startup but I don't know what it is because the windows hat pops up doesn't show any info
you might take a look at your logs to see if there's anything that jumps out at you
I used to believe that there are many logs across my system... which one?
unfortunately, now that i installed (via jockey) the nvidia-current and rebooted, my desktop won't load.......
do Ctrl-Alt-F1 to get to a terminal
yes and what should I do to fix? apt-get remove nvidia-current??
maybe look at /var/log/Xorg.0.log for EE or WW messages that might provide more information?
no errors in xorg. But in syslog many WARNINGS about too fast respawning of compiz.desktop
ah - well there you go (don't know what to suggest about that, though)
to go back to the previous situation, apt-remove nvidia-current could help?
